channel.title: rant on I Prefer Jim
channel.description: Recent content in rant on I Prefer Jim

item.title: Google Now, the new NSA
item.description: I’m going to make a bold claim here, but I don’t care. Google Now is essentially a mechanism to spy on people and I think everyone should disable the feature immediately.

item.title: Your interview questions probably suck
item.description: I have interviewed somewhere between 200 and 300 people in my professional career. I’ve learned a lot from the process. In fact, I am planning to write a short book containing some of this “knowledge” about interviewing.

item.title: System76 notebooks… are they worth the money?
item.description: On June 19 2012, I purchased a 15″ Pangolin Performance with the following configuration: Ubuntu 12.04 LTS 64 bit 15.

item.title: Android Studio and Library Projects
item.description: This is basically a quick brain-dump post. I have previously attempted to get into Android application development, but with only 8-10 hours of “free” time per month, it was difficult to get traction with an app before the goog machine overhauled everything.

item.title: Why I don’t recommend the Step module [node.js, npm]
item.description: I prefer asyc to step. The async module has a cleaner interface, more options, and utilities. It’s a little beefier in size, but those things are beside the point.

item.title: Note about Copyrights
item.description: You wouldn’t think this would be necessary, but it seems that it is. All work on my site and in my projects is copyrighted.

item.title: Mixing Business Logic and the Presentation Layer… Why do people do it?
item.description: In .NET Application Architecture Guide, 2nd Edition, the writers explicitly say: Do not mix different types of components in the same logical layer.

item.title: LINQ: more like "Luckily I Never Quit"
item.description: I’ve been using LINQ quite a bit lately. As the blog title says: luckily, I never quit. There are a lot of things to get used to with LINQ.
